name: Roasted Okra and Onions
description: Buy the freshest, firmest okra you can find. Pick pods that are no bigger than your ring finger. Slicing them lengthwise just before you roast them will keep slime to a minimum. This basic technique is very accommodating. You can add quartered yellow squash or zucchini, or even a chopped up fresh tomato. The trick is to roast the vegetables until the edges of the onion begin to turn brown.
keywords: appetizer, side dish, basil, mint, okra, vidalia onion, fall, summer, vegetarian
recipeIngredient: 1 pound okra pods, washed, capped and cut in half lengthwise
1 Vidalia (or other sweet) onion, small, sliced into crescents
Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the oven to 400 degrees. Combine okra and onion in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper, drizzle with olive oil and toss well to coat. Roast until vegetables are just tender, 10 to 12 minutes. Toss with herbs and serve.

video.name: Don’t Fear the Okra
video.description: Kim Severson shows you how to shop for okra and make a simple dish without the slime.
